page.title: 01ST.ANDREWS -"HOME OF GOLF"
page.content: The chief interest of this area is the five golf courses, especially the famous OLD COURSE. Thousands of visitors from all over the world come to play here and major golf tournaments are held regularly. The ROYAL AND ANCIENT GOLF CLUB is the international arbitrator on the rules of the game. The beach also attracts hundreds of holiday-makers and the modern OLD COURSE HOTEL and the Victorian GRAND HOTEL (Hamilton Hall) typify the changing style of tourism over the last 100 years - as do the Edwardian band-stand and the modern windsurfing school. Strathtyrum is the only large estate but there are Victorian mansions on the cliff top and a church. The rest of the area contains farm land, mud flats and dunes. Erosion is a problem.
